intro: Andryala glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular andryala, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with serrated edges and small, yellowish-green flowers clustered in umbels. Its stems are often covered in glandular hairs, which give it its common name. Andryala glandulosa is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
